title: `geomultistar` objects generator from American Community Survey (ACS) geodatabases
text: multidimensional data model defined aim supporting data analysis. multidimensional systems, data structured facts dimensions1. star model widely accepted, recommended use widely distributed end-user tools. geographical dimension plays fundamental role multidimensional systems. interesting possibility representing reports obtained multidimensional systems, using geographic dimensions, map, performing spatial analysis . functionality supported package geomultistar. American Community Survey (ACS), within United States Census Bureau (USCB), offers databases can structured using multidimensional data model take advantage characteristics consulted. characteristic databases geographic component form vector layer. reason, structures offered package geomultistar suitable representing data. main objective package automatically generate multidimensional structures based geomultistar package geodatabases provided ACS, can easily queried users. packages available useful access data, tidycensus, works integrated way tigris. main characteristics geogenr distinguish proposals following: works locally, available geodatabases downloaded (can downloaded using package); supports access level group variables integrated layer, instead level variable vector variables; decomposes ACS composite variables structured fields; allows directly integrate variables several years; automatically structures data using multidimensional data model. rest document structured follows: First, starting data presented. , illustrative example package works developed. Finally, document ends conclusions.

title: `geomultistar` objects generator from American Community Survey (ACS) geodatabases
text: package based geodatabases available TIGER/Line Selected Demographic Economic Data web page. year (2010) list geodatabases appears two sections: Legal Administrative Areas; Statistical Areas. mentioned year 2018 (last one accessible moment), literally: “geodatabases bring together geography 2018 TIGER/Line Shapefiles data 2014-2018 American Community Survey (ACS) 5-year estimates.” Similar data offered previous years periods corresponding one. ACS geodatabase structured layers: geographic layer, metadata layer, rest data layers. data layers matrix form, rows indexed instances geographic layer, columns variables defined metadata layer, cells numeric values. two examples: GEOID          B00001e1 B00001m1 B00002e1 B00002m1 16000US0200065       60       -1      300       -1 16000US0200650       20       -1       20       -1 16000US0200760      350       -1      100       -1 16000US0200870      250       -1       60       -1 16000US0201090      200       -1       30       -1 16000US0201200      450       -1      100       -1 ... GEOID          B01001e1 B01001m1 B01001e2 B01001m2 B01001e3 B01001m3 B01001e4 B01001m4 ... 16000US0100100      218      165       92      114       10       16       18       30 16000US0100124     2582       24     1313       98       45       37       14       19 16000US0100460     4374       24     1963      158      144       76      105       68 16000US0100484      641      159      326       89       10       17       16       11 16000US0100676      295      102      143       55        7       11       14       17 16000US0100820    32878       57    16236      453     1159      257     1151      209 ... defined variables shown . Short Name Full Name B00001e1   UNWEIGHTED SAMPLE COUNT POPULATION: Total: Total Population -- (Estimate) B00001m1   UNWEIGHTED SAMPLE COUNT POPULATION: Total: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B00002e1   UNWEIGHTED SAMPLE HOUSING UNITS: Total: Housing Units -- (Estimate) B00002m1   UNWEIGHTED SAMPLE HOUSING UNITS: Total: Housing Units -- (Margin Error) B01001e1   SEX AGE: Total: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m1   SEX AGE: Total: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e2   SEX AGE: Male: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m2   SEX AGE: Male: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e3   SEX AGE: Male: 5 years: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m3   SEX AGE: Male: 5 years: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e4   SEX AGE: Male: 5 9 years: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m4   SEX AGE: Male: 5 9 years: Total Population -- (Margin Error) ... variable (Short Name) corresponds combinations various field values separated separator (:), forming string (Full Name). field name value available topics included detailed web page Subjects Included Survey. thousands variables characteristics (50,000) , addition metadata layer, can found TIGER/Line Selected Demographic Economic Data Record Layouts web page. combination values, one variable associated estimate another margin error defined. Within layer, variables can considered groups, defined first part Full Name (example UNWEIGHTED SAMPLE HOUSING UNITS SEX AGE). module geogenr package analyses components Full_name, structuring fields; allows access variables groups.

title: `geomultistar` objects generator from American Community Survey (ACS) geodatabases
text: data available form geodatabase. One geodatabase area two area sections. consult areas sections use object class uscb_acs_5ye. creating , can indicate folder used destination downloads, another indicated. operations get lists available areas. Since geodatabases included package, selected area smallest databases. following operations2, obtain years geodatabases chosen area available web, download corresponding selected years.
code: library(geogenr)  ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = "../data/us/")  (laa <- ua |> get_legal_and_administrative_areas()) #>  [1] "Alaska Native Regional Corporation"                 #>  [2] "American Indian/Alaska Native/Native Hawaiian Area" #>  [3] "Congressional District (116th Congress)"            #>  [4] "County"                                             #>  [5] "Elementary School District"                         #>  [6] "Place"                                              #>  [7] "Secondary School District"                          #>  [8] "State"                                              #>  [9] "State Legislative Districts - Lower Chamber"        #> [10] "State Legislative Districts - Upper Chamber"        #> [11] "Unified School District"                            #> [12] "Zip Code Tabulation Area"  (sa <- ua |> get_statistical_areas()) #>  [1] "Combined New England City and Town Area"    #>  [2] "Combined Statistical Area"                  #>  [3] "Metropolitan Division"                      #>  [4] "Metropolitan/Micropolitan Statistical Area" #>  [5] "New England City and Town Area"             #>  [6] "New England City and Town Area Division"    #>  [7] "Public Use Microdata Area"                  #>  [8] "Tribal Block Group"                         #>  [9] "Tribal Census Tract"                        #> [10] "Urban Area" sa[6] #>  [1] "New England City and Town Area Division"  (y <- ua |> get_available_years_in_the_web(geodatabase = sa[6])) #>  [1] 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018  (y_res <- ua |> download_geodatabases(geodatabase = sa[6], years = 2014:2015)) #>  [1] 2014 2015

title: `geomultistar` objects generator from American Community Survey (ACS) geodatabases
text: geodatabases available locally, move selecting data. case create new object class uscb_acs_5ye indicating folder downloaded geodatabases : package data folder. Using following function, check years available locally selected area. Using metadata included package (uscb_acs_metadata), object class uscb_acs_5ye data areas included, area selected geodatabase reference year, create object class uscb_layer, can consult layer names available area year, shown . available layers, obtain one can consult groups variables includes, shown following operations. obtain one groups indicating name, shown . Groups contain sets variables. variables selected group shown .
code: folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "geogenr") folder <- stringr::str_replace_all(paste(folder, "/", ""), " ", "") ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = folder) sa[6] #> [1] "New England City and Town Area Division"  (y <- ua |> get_available_years_downloaded(geodatabase = sa[6])) #> [1] 2014 2015 ul <- uscb_layer(uscb_acs_metadata, ua = ua, geodatabase = sa[6], year = 2015) (layers <- ul |> get_layer_names()) #> [1] "X00_COUNTS"      "X01_AGE_AND_SEX" "X02_RACE" layers[3] #> [1] "X02_RACE"  ul <- ul |> get_layer(layers[3]) (layer_groups <- ul |> get_layer_group_names()) #>  [1] "001 - RACE"                                                                                              #>  [2] "003 - DETAILED RACE"                                                                                     #>  [3] "008 - WHITE ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"                                        #>  [4] "009 - BLACK OR AFRICAN AMERICAN ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"                    #>  [5] "010 - AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"            #>  [6] "011 - ASIAN ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"                                        #>  [7] "012 - NATIVE HAWAIIAN AND OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"   #>  [8] "013 - SOME OTHER RACE ALONE OR IN COMBINATION WITH ONE OR MORE OTHER RACES"                              #>  [9] "014 - AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE ALONE FOR SELECTED TRIBAL GROUPINGS"                             #> [10] "015 - ASIAN ALONE BY SELECTED GROUPS"                                                                    #> [11] "016 - NATIVE HAWAIIAN AND OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER ALONE BY SELECTED GROUPS"                               #> [12] "017 - AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE (AIAN) ALONE OR IN ANY COMBINATION BY SELECTED TRIBAL GROUPINGS" #> [13] "018 - ASIAN ALONE OR IN ANY COMBINATION BY SELECTED GROUPS"                                              #> [14] "019 - NATIVE HAWAIIAN AND OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER ALONE OR IN ANY COMBINATION BY SELECTED GROUPS" layer_groups[2] #> [1] "003 - DETAILED RACE"  ul <- ul |> get_layer_group(layer_groups[2]) ul$layer_group_columns #>  [1] "GEOID"     "C02003e1"  "C02003m1"  "C02003e2"  "C02003m2"  "C02003e3"  #>  [7] "C02003m3"  "C02003e4"  "C02003m4"  "C02003e5"  "C02003m5"  "C02003e6"  #> [13] "C02003m6"  "C02003e7"  "C02003m7"  "C02003e8"  "C02003m8"  "C02003e9"  #> [19] "C02003m9"  "C02003e10" "C02003m10" "C02003e11" "C02003m11" "C02003e12" #> [25] "C02003m12" "C02003e13" "C02003m13" "C02003e14" "C02003m14" "C02003e15" #> [31] "C02003m15" "C02003e16" "C02003m16" "C02003e17" "C02003m17" "C02003e18" #> [37] "C02003m18" "C02003e19" "C02003m19"

option METHOD  names(ft) #>  [1] "year"                              "cnectafp"                          #>  [3] "nectafp"                           "nctadvfp"                          #>  [5] "geoid"                             "name"                              #>  [7] "namelsad"                          "lsad"                              #>  [9] "mtfcc"                             "aland" "shape_area"                        "geoid_data"                        #> [17] "short_name"                        "full_name"                         #> [19] "inf_code"                          "group_code"                        #> [21] "spec_code"                         "inf"                               #> [23] "group"                             "demographic_race"                  #> [25] "demographic_race_spec"             "demographic_total_population"      #> [27] "demographic_total_population_spec" "estimate"                          #> [29] "margin_of_error"                   "shape"  nrow(ft) #> [1] 190 gms <- ul |> get_geomultistar() #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD uf <- uscb_folder(ul) cft <- uf |> get_common_flat_table() #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD  #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD  nrow(cft) #> [1] 380 cgms <- uf |> get_common_geomultistar() #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD

title: `geomultistar` objects generator from American Community Survey (ACS) geodatabases
text: geomultistar object, can use functionality geomultistar package. Specifically, field geographic information directly associated geoid. want associate information fields dimension, name field, must using operation shown . can define multidimensional queries using functionality starschemar package, shown . first rows result can seen table form. result vector layer can save, perform spatial analysis queries , can see map, using functions associated sf class.
code: library(geomultistar)  cgms <- cgms  |>   define_geoattribute(     attribute = c("name"),     from_attribute = "geoid"   ) library(starschemar)  gdqr <- dimensional_query(cgms) |>   select_dimension(name = "where",                    attributes = c("name")) |>   select_dimension(name = "what",                    attributes = c("short_name", "demographic_race_spec")) |>   select_fact(name = "detailed_race",               measures = c("estimate")) |>   filter_dimension(name = "when", year == "2015") |>   filter_dimension(name = "what", demographic_race_spec == "Asian alone") |>   run_geoquery() class(gdqr) #> [1] "sf"         "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame"  plot(gdqr[,"estimate"])

title: `geomultistar` Object Generator from American Community Survey Geodatabases
text: ACS geodatabase structured layers: geographic layer, metadata layer, rest data layers. data layers matrix form, rows indexed instances geographic layer, columns variables defined metadata layer, cells numeric values. example: GEOID          B01001e1 B01001m1 B01001e2 B01001m2 B01001e3 B01001m3 B01001e4 B01001m4 ... 16000US0100100      218      165       92      114       10       16       18       30 16000US0100124     2582       24     1313       98       45       37       14       19 16000US0100460     4374       24     1963      158      144       76      105       68 16000US0100484      641      159      326       89       10       17       16       11 16000US0100676      295      102      143       55        7       11       14       17 16000US0100820    32878       57    16236      453     1159      257     1151      209 ... defined variables shown . Short Name Full Name B01001e1   SEX AGE: Total: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m1   SEX AGE: Total: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e2   SEX AGE: Male: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m2   SEX AGE: Male: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e3   SEX AGE: Male: 5 years: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m3   SEX AGE: Male: 5 years: Total Population -- (Margin Error) B01001e4   SEX AGE: Male: 5 9 years: Total Population -- (Estimate) B01001m4   SEX AGE: Male: 5 9 years: Total Population -- (Margin Error) ... First, select download ACS geodatabases using functions offered package. folder (case examples included package), basic example shows solve common problem: folder, get years one area geodatabases downloaded. select geodatabase specific year (uscb_layer). among layers groups variables available, select layer (get_layer) one groups (get_layer_group). selected variables generate geomultistar object (get_geomultistar). first rows dimension fact tables shown . geomultistar object, can use functionality starschemar geomultistar packages define multidimensional queries geographic information. result vector layer can save, perform spatial analysis queries , can see map, using functions associated sf class.  verified data reference year need, can expand database considering rest years available folder. requirement consider year variable structure reference year. Instead displaying tables, focus table dimension. Includes data available years.
code: library(geogenr)  folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "geogenr") folder <- stringr::str_replace_all(paste(folder, "/", ""), " ", "") ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = folder)  (sa <- ua |> get_statistical_areas()) #>  [1] "Combined New England City and Town Area"    #>  [2] "Combined Statistical Area"                  #>  [3] "Metropolitan Division"                      #>  [4] "Metropolitan/Micropolitan Statistical Area" #>  [5] "New England City and Town Area"             #>  [6] "New England City and Town Area Division"    #>  [7] "Public Use Microdata Area"                  #>  [8] "Tribal Block Group"                         #>  [9] "Tribal Census Tract"                        #> [10] "Urban Area"  (y <- ua |> get_available_years_downloaded(geodatabase = sa[6])) #> [1] 2014 2015  ul <- uscb_layer(uscb_acs_metadata, ua = ua, geodatabase = sa[6], year = 2015) (layers <- ul |> get_layer_names()) #> [1] "X00_COUNTS"      "X01_AGE_AND_SEX" "X02_RACE"  ul <- ul |> get_layer(layers[2]) (layer_groups <- ul |> get_layer_group_names()) #> [1] "001 - SEX BY AGE"        "002 - MEDIAN AGE BY SEX" #> [3] "003 - TOTAL POPULATION"  ul <- ul |> get_layer_group(layer_groups[1])  gms <- ul |> get_geomultistar() #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD library(starschemar) library(geomultistar)  gms <- gms  |>   define_geoattribute(     attribute = c("name"),     from_attribute = "geoid"   )  gdqr <- dimensional_query(gms) |>   select_dimension(name = "where",                    attributes = c("name")) |>   select_dimension(     name = "what",     attributes = c("short_name")   ) |>   select_fact(name = "sex_by_age",               measures = c("estimate")) |>   filter_dimension(name = "when", year == "2015") |>   filter_dimension(name = "what",                    demographic_age == "Under 5 years") |>   run_geoquery() plot(gdqr[,"estimate"]) uf <- uscb_folder(ul)  cgms <- uf |> get_common_geomultistar() #> Warning in CPL_read_ogr(dsn, layer, query, as.character(options), quiet, : GDAL #> Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
text: Get layer group data form geomultistar object geodatabases folder selected: contains fact dimension tables, dimension associated geographic layer.

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
code: get_common_geomultistar(uf)  # S3 method for uscb_folder get_common_geomultistar(uf)

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
text: uf uscb_folder object.

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
text: geomultistar object.

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
text: name facts layer group name.

title: Get common geomultistar — get_common_geomultistar
code: folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "geogenr") folder <- stringr::str_replace_all(paste(folder, "/", ""), " ", "") ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = folder) sa <- ua |> get_statistical_areas() # sa[6] # [1] "New England City and Town Area Division" ul <- uscb_layer(uscb_acs_metadata, ua = ua, geodatabase = sa[6], year = 2015) layers <- ul |> get_layer_names() # layers[3] # [1] "X02_RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer(layers[3]) lg <- ul |> get_layer_group_names() # lg[2] # [1] "003 - DETAILED RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer_group(lg[2]) uf <- uscb_folder(ul)  gms <- uf |> get_common_geomultistar() #> Warning: GDAL Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD

code: folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "geogenr") folder <- stringr::str_replace_all(paste(folder, "/", ""), " ", "") ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = folder) sa <- ua |> get_statistical_areas() # sa[6] # [1] "New England City and Town Area Division" ul <- uscb_layer(uscb_acs_metadata, ua = ua, geodatabase = sa[6], year = 2015) layers <- ul |> get_layer_names() # layers[3] # [1] "X02_RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer(layers[3]) lg <- ul |> get_layer_group_names() # lg[2] # [1] "003 - DETAILED RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer_group(lg[2])  layer <- ul |> get_flat_table() #> Warning: GDAL Message 6: driver OpenFileGDB does not support open option METHOD

title: uscb_folder S3 class — uscb_folder
code: folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "geogenr") folder <- stringr::str_replace_all(paste(folder, "/", ""), " ", "") ua <- uscb_acs_5ye(folder = folder) sa <- ua |> get_statistical_areas() # sa[6] # [1] "New England City and Town Area Division" ul <- uscb_layer(uscb_acs_metadata, ua = ua, geodatabase = sa[6], year = 2015) layers <- ul |> get_layer_names() # layers[3] # [1] "X02_RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer(layers[3]) lg <- ul |> get_layer_group_names() # lg[2] # [1] "003 - DETAILED RACE" ul <- ul |> get_layer_group(lg[2])  uf <- uscb_folder(ul)
